thread.title: Oregon shooting: Congressional delegation's resolution condemns attack, recognizes first responders
thread.title_full: Oregon shooting: Congressional delegation's resolution condemns attack, recognizes first responders

author: Luke Hammill | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Oregon shooting: Congressional delegation's resolution condemns attack, recognizes first responders
text:
Comments 
Oregon's congressional delegation on Thursday introduced a resolution in both the House of Representatives and the Senate to condemn last week's shooting spree at Umpqua Community College and recognize those who responded to the attack. 
"Deceased and surviving victims demonstrated acts of heroism and sacrifice for the safety and sake of others. ... The first responders were swift and professional in their response to the initial call, which avoided even more bloodshed," the resolution reads, according to a news release. 
The resolution goes on to offer condolences to the families and friends of the nine who were "murdered by an armed gunman" and express hope for the "swift and complete recovery" of the nine who were wounded. 
The Senate version of the resolution says that the legislative body "remains committed to reducing the likelihood of this kind of event happening again." 
Ron Wyden and Jeff Merkley represent Oregon in the Senate, and Peter DeFazio, Greg Walden, Kurt Schrader, Earl Blumenauer and Suzanne Bonamici represent the state in the House. All but Walden are Democrats. 
Wyden and Merkley also joined Senate Democrats on Thursday to push for gun-control legislation . 
-- Luke Hammill
